title: Pixel-identical technical SEO + performance improvements for landing page

requirements.summary: Lock in the pixel-identical UI constraint by restricting all changes to non-visual technical optimizations and adding guardrails to avoid accidental UI/copy modifications.
acceptanceCriteria: A before/after visual comparison of the landing page shows no pixel-level differences in content, layout, spacing, colors, typography, images, icons, and section ordering.
No user-facing strings are changed anywhere in the UI.

file_operations.description: Refactor to introduce lazy-loading/SEO injection in a way that preserves the exact rendered UI structure and ordering once loaded; do not modify any visible copy, layout, spacing, or styling.
Apply only non-visual image/intrinsic sizing attributes and decoding/loading optimizations; ensure no changes to any visible strings, layout, or styling.
Apply only non-visual image/intrinsic sizing attributes and decoding/loading optimizations; ensure the rendered visuals remain pixel-identical.
Apply only non-visual image/intrinsic sizing attributes and decoding/loading optimizations; ensure the rendered visuals remain pixel-identical.
Add SEO metadata tags only (no visible UI impact) and avoid introducing any render-blocking scripts in head.

requirements.summary: Code-split and lazy-load below-the-fold sections after the tools grid so above-the-fold content ships less JS while keeping the final UI identical.
acceptanceCriteria: Below-the-fold sections (those rendered after the tools grid) are loaded via dynamic import (React.lazy) and do not block initial render of the hero/search/tools area.
No layout shift (CLS) is introduced in the initial viewport due to lazy loading.
The page remains functionally identical after all chunks load (same components, same order, same styling).

file_operations.description: Replace direct imports of below-the-fold sections (TrustSection, WhyUseSection, CTASection, FAQSection, Footer if applicable) with React.lazy dynamic imports and wrap them in Suspense; ensure the fallback preserves initial viewport stability (no CLS) and that the fully-loaded render is identical to today.

requirements.summary: Defer non-critical JavaScript work so it runs after first paint/interaction without changing behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: No new render-blocking scripts are added to the document head.
Any non-critical work (e.g., below-the-fold preloading) is scheduled after initial render (e.g., requestIdleCallback / setTimeout) and does not delay above-the-fold rendering.
The landing page remains fully functional with identical behavior.

file_operations.description: Schedule any optional preloading of lazy-loaded below-the-fold sections using requestIdleCallback (with setTimeout fallback) after the initial render to avoid blocking first paint/interaction; preserve identical final behavior/UI.
Ensure metadata changes do not introduce any render-blocking scripts in head; keep the existing module script placement in body.

requirements.summary: Optimize images technically (intrinsic sizing, async decoding, lazy loading) and add modern format serving via picture where feasible, without any appearance changes.
acceptanceCriteria: Images used in tool cards and other sections do not cause layout shifts (CLS does not increase).
All non-critical images remain lazy-loaded and use async decoding.
If modern formats are added, the fallback preserves identical pixel dimensions and appearance compared to current PNGs.

file_operations.description: Add explicit width/height attributes matching the current rendered size for tool logos (keeping existing className sizing), and ensure decoding="async" + loading="lazy" remain for non-critical images; do not change any visible layout/styling.
Add explicit intrinsic sizing (width/height or equivalent) for company logo images to prevent layout shifts while keeping existing lazy loading and decoding async; preserve identical visuals.
Ensure feature icon images use decoding="async", loading="lazy" where appropriate (below-the-fold), and include intrinsic sizing matching the current rendered dimensions; preserve identical visuals.

requirements.summary: Tighten React Query configuration at the hook level to improve caching, reduce unnecessary refetches, and prevent duplicate requests (without touching frontend/src/main.tsx).
acceptanceCriteria: Repeated navigations/rehydrations do not trigger redundant immediate refetches for the same tool data within a reasonable freshness window (staleTime).
React Query hooks define appropriate staleTime/cache (gcTime) and disable refetch-on-focus/reconnect where safe for this landing page use case.
No duplicate simultaneous requests for the same queryKey occur during initial load (dedupe behavior verified in Network panel).

file_operations.description: Configure query options per hook (e.g., staleTime, gcTime, refetchOnWindowFocus=false, refetchOnReconnect=false, and other safe dedupe-friendly settings) to prevent redundant refetching for public landing-page data, while keeping behavior functionally identical.

requirements.summary: Ensure skeleton loading UI disappears immediately when tools data is available (no visual changes to the skeleton design).
acceptanceCriteria: When tools data is available, the tools grid renders immediately and skeletons are not shown concurrently or longer than necessary.
No new loading UI is introduced and existing loading UI is not visually modified.

file_operations.description: Adjust the skeleton gating condition so skeletons render only when data is truly unavailable/pending, and never persist once tool data has resolved (including cached data cases); do not change skeleton markup/styling.

requirements.summary: Add technical SEO metadata in frontend/index.html (title/description/canonical/Open Graph/Twitter) using existing on-page messaging only.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html contains a single title tag and a meta description that matches existing on-page messaging (no new marketing copy invented).
A canonical link tag is present.
Open Graph tags (og:title, og:description, og:type, og:url) and Twitter tags (twitter:card, twitter:title, twitter:description) are present.
No visible UI changes occur due to metadata changes.

file_operations.description: Update head metadata: ensure a single <title>, add meta description derived from existing Hero/Footer messaging, add canonical link, and add Open Graph + Twitter meta tags; do not add any render-blocking scripts or change visible UI.

requirements.summary: Add sitemap.xml and robots.txt as static frontend assets to allow indexing and discovery of the landing page.
acceptanceCriteria: A valid robots.txt exists that allows indexing (no Disallow of the main page).
A valid sitemap.xml exists and includes at least the landing page URL.
Both files are served as static assets from the frontend (no backend routing required).

file_operations.description: Create a robots.txt that allows indexing and points to the sitemap URL; ensure it does not disallow the landing page.
Create a valid sitemap.xml including at least the landing page canonical URL (ensure it matches the canonical configured in frontend/index.html).

requirements.summary: Inject JSON-LD structured data (WebSite, Organization, ItemList) that matches landing page semantics without affecting visible UI.
acceptanceCriteria: The rendered document includes a <script type="application/ld+json"> containing WebSite and Organization objects.
An ItemList JSON-LD block is present representing the tools list (at minimum name + url for each item, derived from the same tool data used on the page).
No visible changes occur; JSON-LD is not rendered into the UI.

file_operations.description: Create a non-visual React component that renders JSON-LD via a <script type="application/ld+json"> tag for WebSite, Organization, and an ItemList derived from the same tool data shown in the grid; ensure no UI rendering/styling changes.
Wire SeoJsonLd into the landing page render so JSON-LD is present in the document; ensure it uses the same tool data used for the tools list and does not introduce visible changes.

requirements.summary: Add a technical-only validation checklist file capturing Lighthouse scores and confirmation of pixel-identical UI.
acceptanceCriteria: A short checklist enumerates each technical change applied (code splitting, metadata, sitemap/robots, caching, image handling).
Lighthouse Performance and SEO scores are recorded for the landing page after changes (target: Performance 90+, SEO 95+).
Checklist explicitly states that no visible content/design changes were made.

file_operations.description: Create a short PR-ready checklist documenting each technical change, recording Lighthouse Performance/SEO scores, and explicitly stating pixel-identical UI/no visible content changes.
